# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

# Solution

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int=3)
    if typeof(dt) <: Date
        throw(ArgumentError("Time zone bumper can only work with DateTime types. You provided a Date type instead."))
    end

    local_time = TimeZones.localtime(dt) # Get the local time in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00
    return Dates.DateTime(TimeZones.localtime(local_time + bump * 3600)) # Increase the time by `bump` hours and convert back to DateTime
end
```
